Award.AwardTitle: MRI: Acquisition of Hybrid Mass Spectrometer for Geochemistry and Environmental Studies
Award.AbstractNarration:
This award provides funding for the acquisition of a hybrid Mass Spectrometer for Texas A&M University-Corpus Christi (TAMUCC). This instrument will make a fundamental contribution to TAMUCC's goals of increasing training and research opportunities for students and faculty, achieving national and international recognition as a premier marine and environmental science research institution, and promoting research collaborations among South Texas universities. This instrument will expand the research capabilities of 12 members of the faculty at TAMUCC. Each of these faculty members has research interests which largely focus on environmental chemistry which is a key component of the growing research endeavor in south Texas. It will provide an essential assessment tool for South Texas scientists to understand aquatic carbon and nitrogen.

With the hybrid Mass Spectrometer researchers will be able to detect and quantify thousands of compounds, including pollutants, in a single analysis and then design experiments to assess the metabolic role or effects of these compounds on organismal and ecosystem health. These areas of research are vital, not only to the rapidly developing South Texas region, but throughout the northern Gulf of Mexico. The PIs represent a broad spectrum of research areas associated with marine and environmental science that would benefit from access to a state-of-the-art mass spectrometer. Research areas include characterization of dissolved organic matter, emerging contaminants, toxins, and natural products. The new instrumentation will enhance these programs as well as open up avenues for new research lines, new collaborations, and public-private partnerships.

POR.DRECONTENT:
A Purchase of the Orbitrap Fusion Tribrid Mass Spectrometer equipped with an ultra high performance liquid chromatogram (UHPLC-OT-FTMS) was made in October 2016 and it was installed in January 2017. It allows us to perform simultaneous de novo structural elucidation and quantification of thousands of natural organic compounds per sample up to attomolar concentrations by providing the unique ability to perform multistage MSn (up to MS10) with high resolution and accuracy. This compact Orbitrap design offers the highest resolving power of its kind (500,000 FWHM at m/z 200), with ability to measure sub-ppm mass accuracy with the use of internal standards. This novel Orbitrap design allows for scan rates up to 20 Hz at very high resolution, which allows for taking full advantage of UHPLC separation. We have used this system to develop techniques used to identify and quantify deaminated peptides in different aquatic environments.

Intellectual Merit: The UHPLC-OT-FTMS system provides state-of-the-art capabilities that are essential assessment tools for South Texas scientists to understand aquatic carbon and nitrogen cycles; it is a keystone instrument in the new Texas A&M University- Corpus Christi (TAMUCC) analytical core facility. We have opened the facility to other researchers at TAMUCC who are interested in, for example, the identification of different emerging contaminants, and in the quantification of molecular biomarkers of deep sediments.

Broader Impacts: This project enhances TAMUCC efforts to develop an advanced research culture in South Texas, which lacks research infrastructure. This instrument will make a fundamental contribution to TAMUCC's goals of increasing training and research opportunities for students and faculty, achieving national and international recognition as a premier marine and environmental science research institution, and promoting research collaborations among South Texas universities. So far, we have trained two Ph.D. students and one undergraduate student on this instrument. We also started to incorporate this instrument into existing advanced instrumental analysis and organic geochemistry courses. All data that will be archived at Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO) database.
